help.overview: provides information about me and a way to get help
help.detailed: provides detailed information about me (invitation link, source code, handling of private data...) and a way to get help if needed (support Discord, Twitter)

about.title: {{ .name }} version {{ .version }}
about.desc: Discord bot dedicated to the {{ .game.Name }} {{ .gameLogo }} game!

support.title: :bulb: Support server
support.desc: You have a problem with its use? A suggestion? Feel free to join the support [Discord server]({{ .discord }})!

twitter.title: {{ .twitterLogo }} Twitter
twitter.desc: I'm also on [Twitter]({{ .twitter }}): you will find the last news!

opensource.title: {{ .githubLogo }} Open source
opensource.desc: All my source code is licensed under GPL-3.0 and accessible on [Github]({{ .github }})

free.title: :money_with_wings: Free
free.desc: All my features are free. You can participate financially but do not go into the red! [Paypal]({{ .paypal }})

privacy.title: :shield: Data privacy
privacy.desc: I take care to collect the strict minimum data needed to run. More informations on the support server!

graphist.title: :art: Visuals
graphist.desc: Visuals made by the great [{{ .Elycann.Name }}]({{ .Elycann.URL }}) and [{{ .Colibry.Name }}]({{ .Colibry.URL }})!

about.footer: Some illustrations are the Ankama Studio property - All rights reserved

detailed.get:
displays the book of aligned players on your Discord server
   - The `city` field is optional and corresponds to the city to which players have pledged allegiance. If not specified, the directory is displayed without considering this filter. *__Example__:Bonta*
 - The `order` field is optional and corresponds to the order joined by players. If not specified, the directory is displayed without considering this filter. *__Example__:Spirit*
 - The `server` field is optional and corresponds to the desired game server. If not specified, the game server used is the one defined for the Discord guild (see `config`). *__Example__:Imagiro*
detailed.set:
records your alignment in the book, independently of the Discord server; this recording cannot be done for others.
   - The `city` field is mandatory and corresponds to the city to which players have pledged allegiance. *__Example__:Bonta*
 - The `order` field is mandatory and corresponds to the order joined by players. *__Example__:Spirit*
 - The `level` field is mandatory and corresponds to the alignment level between 0 and 200, with 0 indicating removal from the directory. *__Example__:200*
 - The `server` field is optional and corresponds to the desired game server. If not specified, the game server used is the one defined for the Discord guild (see `config`). *__Example__:Imagiro*

help.source: The collected data is used only for my proper functioning.

believers.title: Aligned list

beliefs.title: {{ .username }} alignments
beliefs.description:
{{ if .beliefs }}{{ range .beliefs}}{{ .City }} {{ .Order }} lvl. {{ .Level }}
{{ end }}{{ else }}No alignment for the moment!{{ end }}

detailed.day:
provides the Almanax for a given day
   - The `date` field is optional and corresponds to the desired Almanax date, in the format DD/MM/YYYY. If not specified, the Almanax for the current day is returned. *__Example__:01/02/2024*
detailed.effects:
provides the next Almanax day corresponding to the chosen effect
   - The `effect` field is mandatory and corresponds to the desired Almanax bonus. *__Example__:Plenty of fish*
detailed.resources:
provides the necessary resources for a given period
   - The `duration` field is optional and corresponds to the desired number of days, ranging from 1 to 30. If not specified, the necessary resources for the next 7 days are returned. *__Example__:30*

help.source: The data comes from [dofusdu.de](http://dofusdu.de), an incredible tech made in Germany which collects and exposes them.

day.title: Almanax of <t:{{ .date }}:D>
day.missing: Oops! I don't have the almanax of this day in my knowledge, I go back this problem to my creators!

effect.title: {{ .query }}
effect.description: *{{ .total }} result{{ if gt .total 1 }}s{{ end }}, page {{ .page }} on {{ .pages }}*
effect.missing: My crystal ball tells me that the desired bonus will not intervene in the next thirty days, I unfortunately not know more :persevere:

resource.title: Almanax of <t:{{ .startDate }}:D> to <t:{{ .endDate }}:D>
resource.description:
{{ if .tributes }}{{ range .tributes}}- {{ .Emoji }} **{{ .Quantity }}**x {{ .Name }}
{{ end }}{{ else }}No needed resource!{{ end }}

character.label: Tributes for {{ .number }} character{{ if gt .number 1 }}s{{ end }}

help.overview: permits to configure game server, Almanax, RSS feeds, tweets or Youtube videos automatic sendings

detailed.get: displays my current configuration for this Discord server
detailed.almanax:
enables/disables the automatic sending of Almanax at midnight
  - The `enabled` field is mandatory and corresponds to the activation or deactivation of this feature. *__Example__:True*
 - The `channel` field is optional and corresponds to the channel where messages will be posted. If not specified, the current channel is used. *__Example__:#general*
detailed.rss:
enables/disables the automatic sending of [RSS feeds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSS)
  - The `feed` field is mandatory and corresponds to a type of RSS feed. *__Example__:Devblog*
 - The `enabled` and `channel` fields are identical to `/config almanax`.
detailed.server:
links the Discord server to a game server
  - The `server` field is mandatory and corresponds to a game server. Once specified, it will be the default value for certain commands such as `align`, `job`, or `pos`. *__Example__:Imagiro*
 - The `channel` field is optional and is used to link a game server to a specific channel. This link takes priority over the link to the Discord server. *__Example__:#general*
detailed.twitch:
enables/disables the automatic sending of Twitch streamer live starting
  - The `streamer` field is mandatory and corresponds to a Twitch streamer name. *__Example__:Eslix Gaming*
 - The `enabled` and `channel` fields are identical to `/config almanax`.
detailed.twitter:
enables/disables the automatic sending of tweets from the official Twitter account of the game
  - The `twitter` field is mandatory and corresponds to a Twitter creator name. *__Example__:DOFUS_EN*
  - The `enabled` and `channel` fields are identical to `/config almanax`.
detailed.youtube:
enables/disables the automatic sending of Youtube creators videos
  - The `videast` field is mandatory and corresponds to a Youtube creator name. *__Example__:Eslix Gaming*
 - The `enabled` and `channel` fields are identical to `/config almanax`.

detailed: It's a bit strange to consult help about the command you're currently using... it seems like you're already doing quite well! :kissing_smiling_eyes:
Provides assistance on command usage. *__Example__::point_right: \*you using the command\**
Even the best need help, but you're pushing it a bit too far!
Well... between us, you're not going to stoop to that, are you? :rolling_eyes:

detailed.get:
displays the craftsmen players on your Discord server
   - The `job` field is mandatory and corresponds to a profession in the game. *__Example__:Lumberjack*
 - The `server` field is optional and corresponds to the desired game server. If not specified, the game server used is the one defined for the Discord guild (see `config`). *__Example__:Imagiro*
detailed.set:
records your profession in the book, independently of the Discord server; this recording cannot be done for others.
    - The `job` field is mandatory and corresponds to a profession in the game. *__Example__:Lumberjack*
 - The `level` field is mandatory and corresponds to the alignment level between 0 and 200, with 0 indicating removal from the directory. *__Example__:200*
 - The `server` field is optional and corresponds to the desired game server. If not specified, the game server used is the one defined for the Discord guild (see `config`). *__Example__:Imagiro*

help.detailed:
randomly draws a competitive map
   - The `number` field is optional and corresponds to a desired competitive map. If not specified, the map is drawn at random. *__Example__:42*

map.title: Map {{ .mapNumber }}
taunt: After this draw, don't come stutter, Blue team! :kissing:
This fight will be really dirty! :underage:
Don't criticize too much my draw, if you continue I draw in loop the map IX.
Is it me or does it smell like melon? :melon:
Oh no waaaay... It will still last over an hour... :weary:
Challenge: statue. How's that, *nooo* ? Oh come on, for the beauty of the game! :relieved:
I wanted to draw a cool map, and I remembered participants didn't deserve that. :rolling_eyes:
Mmmmmmh, that's the smell of butchery! :horse:

help.overview: provides the most recent dimension portal positions
help.detailed:
provides the most recent positions of dimensional portals
   - The `dimension` field is optional and corresponds to a desired dimension. If not specified, the positions of portals for all dimensions are returned. *__Example__:Enurado*
 - The `server` field is optional and corresponds to the desired game server. If not specified, the game server used is the one defined for the Discord guild (see `config`). *__Example__:Imagiro*
help.source: The data comes from [dofus-portals.fr](https://dofus-portals.fr/), which relies on the participation of portal seekers.

help.detailed:
provides information about sets in the game
   - The `query` field is mandatory and corresponds to the name of the set you want to look up. *__Example__:Boon Set*
help.source: The data comes from [dofusdu.de](http://dofusdu.de), an incredible tech made in Germany which collects and exposes them.

date.constraints: The date must respect the following format: DD/MM/YYYY :)
date.outOfBounds: This date is out of my knowledge! I know I'm amazing but still, I'm not Xelor god! :face_with_peeking_eye:

dimension.not_found: Aie! '*{{ .value }}*' does not correspond to any dimensions I know! :pensive:
dimension.too_many: Outch! '*{{ .value }}*' matches too many dimensions ({{ if .collection }}{{$first := true}}{{ range .collection}}{{if $first}}{{$first = false}}{{else}}, {{end}}{{ . }}{{ end }}{{ end }})! If you want to get all, don't fill this option :slight_smile:

duration.constraints: The duration must be between {{ .min }} and {{ .max }} days :)

feed.not_found: Aie! '*{{ .value }}*' does not correspond to any RSS feeds I know! :pensive:
feed.too_many: Outch! '*{{ .value }}*' matches too many RSS feeds ({{ if .collection }}{{$first := true}}{{ range .collection}}{{if $first}}{{$first = false}}{{else}}, {{end}}{{ . }}{{ end }}{{ end }})! :slight_smile:
